thread.title: Dutch Open: Ajay eyes vijay
thread.title_full: Dutch Open: Ajay eyes vijay - The Times of India

author: M Ratnakar
title: Dutch Open: Ajay eyes vijay
text:
HYDERABAD: Three weeks after reaching the final of the Korean Open Super Series, Ajay Jayaram is just a step away from extending his reign over the Dutch Open Grand Prix. The Mumbai shuttler broke no sweat as he ousted Goh Soon Huat of Malaysia 21-14, 21-15 in only 40 minutes. The defending champion got off to a fluent start as he opened up with 6-2 lead and never looked back. 

In the second game, a determined Goh secured a 6-2 lead before Jayaram wiped off the margin with a six point burst (8-6). Thereafter, it was Jayaram all the way .From 13-11, Jayaram moved to 17-11 leaving little scope for Goh to fight back. 

The world No. 26 is delighted with his performance. "It has been a good week so far. Happy to have pulled through some long hard matches. I was quite confident getting into today's semifinal. I started off well with some good aggressive badminton and did well to maintain pressure," said Jayaram, who will face Raul Must of Estonia in the title clash on Sunday . 

Krishna-Satwik in final 

Top seeds Krishna Prasad Garaga and Satwiksairaj Rankireddy raced into the boys doubles final of the Badminton Asia Junior Championships in Kudus, Indonesia, on Saturday . 

The shuttlers, who train in Hyderabad, outclassed Chinese Taipei's Chen Lu and Li Wei Su 21-14, 21-14. 

Meanwhile, P Gopichand's daughter Gayatri and her partner Vaishnavi Reddy settled for bronze as they suffered a straight game loss against Putri Larasati and Melanni Mamahit of Indonesia 17-21, 18-21 Second seed Lakshya Sen lost a hard fought semifinal against Bagas Kristianto Nugroho of Indonesia. After losing the first game, Sen won the second before faltering in the third 18-21, 21-17, 18-21. 

Indian results (SFs): 

Boy's singles (under-17): Bagas Kristianto Nugroho (Ina) bt Lakshya Sen 21-18, 17-21, 21-18. 

Girls doubles (U-15): 

Putri LarasatiMelanni Mamahit (Ina) bt Gayatri Gopichand Vaishnavi Reddy 21-17, 21-18.
